quote: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: A grieving woman could sit alone on a jetty in the early morning. But not with a book in her hands.
author: Pia Juul

quote: A painting is worth a thousand confused art-gallery visitors.
author: Ljupka Cvetanova

quote: A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn’t implement any of it.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: A person with a sharp tongue will eventually cut themselves.
author: J. Robson Koenig

quote: A skunk is better company than a person who prides himself on being ‘frank’.
author: Robert Heinlein

quote: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he’d rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

quote: A true friend overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
author: Doug Larson

quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: A word of kindness is seldom spoken in vain, while witty sayings are as easily lost as the pearls slipping from a broken string.
author: George Dennison Prentice

quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

quote: Action will destroy your procrastination.
author: Og Mandino

quote: All progress has resulted from people who took unpopular positions.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: And in the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Arguing with a fool proves there are two.
author: Doris M. Smith

quote: Ask me no questions, and I’ll tell you no fibs.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day, you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

quote: Courtship is to marriage, as a very witty prologue to a very dull play.
author: William Congreve

quote: Do your own thinking independently. Be the chess player, not the chess piece.
author: Ralph Charell

quote: Don’t be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Don’t worry about people stealing an idea. If it’s original, you will have to ram it down their throats.
author: Howard Aiken

quote: Dreams don’t work unless you do.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That’s why dreamers are lonely.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Every habit makes our hand more witty, and out wit more handy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don’t laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.
author: Criss Jami

quote: Faced with the choice between changing one’s mind and proving that there is no need to do so, almost everyone gets busy on the proof.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Fools learn from experience. Wise men learn from the experience of others.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Friends are like melons; shall I tell you why? To find a good one, you must one hundred try.
author: Claude Mermet

quote: Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Alva Edison

quote: He wasn’t aware of it but when he smiled he looked like an amiable bear. When he didn’t smile he didn’t look amiable.
author: Emma Goldrick

quote: He who wrestles with us, strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skills. Our antagonist is our helper.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: How you think when you lose determines how long it will be until you win.
author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quote: I don’t let go of concepts –I meet them with understanding. Then they let go of me.
author: Byron Katie

quote: I not only use all the brains I have, but all that I can borrow.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: I suppose it is tempting, if the only tool you have is a hammer, to treat everything as if it were a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: I’m an angel. The horns are only there to hold up the halo.
author: Suzanne Wrightt

quote: I’ll go anywhere as long as it’s forward.
author: David Livingstone

quote: If an apology is followed by an excuse or a reason, it means they are going to commit same mistake again they just apologized for.
author: Amit Kalantri

quote: If you tell the truth, you don’t have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: If you’re not failing every now and again, it’s a sign you’re not doing anything very innovative.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Intelligence is more important than strength, that is why earth is ruled by men and not by animals.
author: Amit Kalantri

quote: It is far better to be alone, than to be in bad company.
author: George Washington

quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: It is not what you gather but what you scatter that tells what kind of life you have lived.
author: Helen Walton

quote: It is surprising what a man can do when he has to, and how little most men will do when they don’t have to.
author: Walter Linn

quote: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
author: John Leonard

quote: It’s never too late to have a happy childhood.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: It’s true hard work never killed anybody, but I figure, why take the chance?
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Knowledge is proud she knows so much; wisdom is humble that she knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
author: Robert J. Sawyer

quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forward.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: Maturity involves turning an insult into a feedback.
author: Aniekee Tochukwu Ezekiel

quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Never miss a good chance to shut up.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Never try to have the last word. You might get it.
author: Robert Heinlein

quote: No-one can make you feel inferior without your permission.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Nothing is so fatiguing as the eternal hanging on of an uncompleted task.
author: William James

quote: Oh yes? Can you identify yourself? Certainly. I’d know me anywhere.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: One man’s theology is another man’s belly laugh.
author: Robert Heinlein

quote: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Phil Hartman was brilliant, and Dave Foley is a really funny guy. Phil Hartman was actually even funnier offstage than he was onstage because he would say nasty things. Dave Foley’s very funny, very witty guy, very quick.
author: Joe Rogan

quote: Playing it safe is the riskiest choice we can ever make.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quote: Pretending to care what men think is an art. It takes moments to learn, but lifetimes to master. I’d like to believe I’m an expert.
author: Dennis Sharpe

quote: Pride only helps us to be generous; it never makes us so, any more than vanity makes us witty.
author: George Eliot

quote: Rhetoric abounds in the cemeteries of reason.
author: Miguel Queah

quote: So just let me deal with it, I can be emotionally flawed and still love you all at the same time. I’m a great multitasker.
author: Holly Hood

quote: Some fellows get credit for being conservative when they are only stupid.
author: Kim Hubbard

quote: The advantage of growing up with siblings is that you become very good at fractions.
author: Robert Brault

quote: The best computer is a man, and it’s the only one that can be mass-produced by unskilled labor.
author: Wernher von Braun

quote: The best way to destroy an enemy is to make him a friend.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself, and you are the easiest person to fool.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make a mistake.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don’t know anything about.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: The important thing to remember is not to forget.
author: Benny Bellamacina

quote: The liar’s punishment is not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The man who does not read books has no advantage over the man that can not read them.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The measure of success is not whether you have a tough problem to deal with, but whether it’s the same problem you had last year.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The problem human beings face is not that we aim too high and fail, but that we aim too low and succeed.
author: Michelangelo

quote: The problem with a life spent reading is you know too much.
author: Josh Lanyon

quote: The reward of a thing done well is to have done it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There is an element of seduction in shoes that doesn’t exist for men. A woman can be sexy, charming, witty or shy with her shoes.
author: Christian Louboutin

quote: There is never a better measure of what a person is than what he does when he’s absolutely free to choose.
author: William M. Bulger

quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: They sit there in committees day after day, And they each put in a color and it comes out gray. And we all have heard the saying, which is true as well as witty, That a camel is a horse that was designed by a committee.
author: Allan Sherman

quote: To be able to ask a question clearly is two-thirds of the way to getting it answered.
author: John Ruskin

quote: To die is poignantly bitter, but the idea of having to die without having lived is unbearable.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: To improve is to change. To be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Want to know something really subversive? Love is everything it’s cracked up to be. It’s really worth fighting for — risking everything for. And the trouble is — if you don’t risk anything, you risk even more.
author: Erica Jong

quote: We all have times when we think more effectively, and times when we should not be thinking at all.
author: Daniel Cohen

quote: We don’t see things as they are. We see them as we are.
author: Anais Nin

quote: We tend to get what we expect.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Well, don’t expect us to be too impressed. We just saw Finnick Odair in his underwear.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: What gets measured gets managed.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: When I die cremate me so I can finally fit into something small.
author: Xondra Day

quote: Whether you think you can or think you can’t, you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Writers don’t get mad they get even in their novels.
author: Candace C. Bowen

quote: You can’t build a reputation on what you’re going to do.
author: Henry Ford

quote: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you’re alone with.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: You know, you’re rather amusingly wrong.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: You will never find time for anything. You must make it.
author: Charles Buxton
